hero.title: Build your next great idea
hero.description: Everything you need to launch your SaaS in days, not months. A complete solution for modern web applications.

features.title: Lightning Fast Performance
features.description: Optimized for speed. Deliver your content to users in milliseconds, improving conversion rates and user experience.

features.title: Bank-grade Security
features.description: Your data is safe with us. We employ industry-standard encryption and security protocols to keep your business secure.

list.quote: SaaSApp changed the way we build software. It's incredibly fast and reliable.
list.author: Alice Johnson

list.quote: The best investment we've made this year. The developer experience is unmatched.

list.quote: We shipped our MVP in record time thanks to this platform. Highly recommended!

footer.brandDesc: Build production-ready SaaS applications with our powerful components, authentication flows, and enterprise features.

5 Projects
Community Support
Basic Analytics

plans.name: Pro

header.title: Choose the Right Plan for You
header.subtitle: Simple, transparent, and no surprise pricing.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to your questions here.

faqs.question: Is your service secure?
faqs.answer: All your data is end-to-end encrypted and protected by top-tier security protocols.

faqs.question: How can I cancel my subscription?
faqs.answer: You can easily cancel your subscription anytime from your profile settings.

faqs.question: Is there a free trial?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can try our Professional plan for 14 days completely free.

faqs.question: Can I change my plan later?
faqs.answer: Absolutely, you can upgrade or downgrade your plan at any time based on your needs.

searchDesc.introduction: Welcome to Nuxt UI SaaS template.

install.subtitle: Get started with Nuxt UI SaaS template.
install.startFresh: You can start a fresh new project with:
install.orCreate: or create a new repository from GitHub:

steps.step3: Enter repository name and click on Create repository from template button
steps.step5: Install dependencies with your favorite package manager

install.thatsIt: That's it! You can now start writing your documentation in the content/ directory ğŸš€

intro.subtitle: Welcome to Nuxt UI SaaS template.
intro.p1: This template is a ready-to-use SaaS template made with Nuxt UI to create beautiful & responsive Nuxt applications in minutes.
intro.p2: This template includes a customizable landing page, a pricing page, a documentation, a blog and authentication pages (login, register).
intro.featuresDesc: This template includes a range of features designed to streamline documentation management:

features.nuxt: Powered by Nuxt: Utilizes the latest Nuxt framework for optimal performance.
features.ui: Built with Nuxt UI: Integrates a comprehensive suite of UI components.
features.mdc: MDC Syntax via Nuxt Content: Supports Markdown with component integration for dynamic content.
features.sidebar: Auto-generated Sidebar Navigation: Automatically generates navigation from content structure.
features.search: Full-Text Search: Includes built-in search functionality for content discovery.
features.typography: Optimized Typography: Features refined typography for enhanced readability.
features.darkMode: Dark Mode: Offers dark mode support for user preference.
features.extensive: Extensive Functionality: Explore the template to fully appreciate its capabilities.

usage.subtitle: Learn how to write and customize.
usage.p1: All your content lives in the content/ directory. This template uses Nuxt Content to turn your Markdown files into pages.
usage.p2: You can use standard Markdown syntax to create your content. Vue components can also be embedded directly within the markdown using the MDC syntax.
usage.markdownDesc: Learn how to write markdown content.

markdown.titlesDesc: Use titles to introduce main sections. They structure your documentation and help users navigate content.
markdown.subtitlesDesc: Use subtitles to divide sections further. They create a more detailed content hierarchy for better readability.
markdown.anchorDesc: Each title and subtitle creates an anchor and shows up automatically in the table of contents.
markdown.formattingDesc: Nuxt UI supports most Markdown formatting options.
markdown.combineDesc: Combine formatting for richer text styles and visual emphasis.
markdown.mathDesc: For exponents, indices, or mathematical notations, use HTML <sup> and <sub> tags.
markdown.linksDesc: Links connect different parts of your documentation and external resources. To create a link, wrap the link text in brackets []().
markdown.internalLinksDesc: For linking within your documentation, use root-relative paths like /getting-started/installation.
markdown.listsDesc: Organize related items in a structured, readable format. Markdown supports unordered, ordered, and nested lists.
markdown.unorderedDesc: Use unordered lists for items without a specific sequence. Start each item with a - symbol.
markdown.orderedDesc: Use ordered lists when item order matters. Start each item with a number.
markdown.nestedDesc: Create hierarchical lists with sub-items. Indent sub-items by four spaces.
markdown.tablesDesc: Present structured data in rows and columns clearly. Tables are ideal for comparing data or listing properties.
markdown.blockquotesDesc: Highlight important quotations, citations, or emphasized text.
markdown.quote1: Nuxt UI is a collection of Vue components, composables and utils designed to create beautiful and accessible user interfaces.
markdown.quote1Short: Nuxt UI is a collection of Vue components...
markdown.quote2: Create beautiful, responsive, and accessible Vue applications with Nuxt UI.

codeblocks.inlineCodeDesc: Use inline code to display code snippets within text paragraphs. It's ideal for referencing code elements directly in sentences.
codeblocks.codeBlocksDesc: Use code blocks to display multi-line code snippets with syntax highlighting. Code blocks are essential for presenting code examples clearly.
codeblocks.filenameDesc: When writing a code-block, you can specify a filename that will be displayed on top of the code block. An icon will be automatically displayed based on the extension or the name.
codeblocks.copyBtnDesc: Every code-block has a built-in copy button that will copy the code to your clipboard.
codeblocks.highlightLineDesc: To highlight lines of code, add {} around the line numbers you want to highlight.
codeblocks.codeGroupDesc: Group code blocks in tabs using code-group. Perfect for showing multiple package managers.
codeblocks.codeTreeDesc: Display code blocks in a file tree view using code-tree.

prose.subtitle: Components to help you structure your content.
prose.accordionDesc: Use accordion and accordion-item to create collapsible content sections. Accordions are useful for organizing FAQs, expandable details, or grouped information in an interactive way.
prose.accQ1: What are the main considerations when upgrading to Nuxt UI v3?
prose.accA1: The transition to v3 involves significant changes, including new component structures, updated theming approaches, and revised TypeScript definitions. We recommend a careful, incremental upgrade process, starting with thorough testing in a development environment.
prose.accQ2: Is Nuxt UI v3 compatible with standalone Vue projects?
prose.accA2: Nuxt UI is now compatible with Vue! You can follow the installation guide to get started.
prose.badgeDesc: Use badge to display status indicators or labels. Badges are great for highlighting version numbers, statuses, or categories within your content.
prose.calloutDesc1: Use callout to emphasize important contextual information. Callouts draw attention to notes, tips, warnings, or cautions, making key information stand out.
prose.calloutDesc2: Customize with icon and color props or use note, tip, warning, caution shortcuts for pre-defined semantic styles.
prose.calloutBase: This is a callout with full markdown support.
prose.calloutNote: Here's some additional information for you.
prose.calloutWarn: Be careful with this action as it might have unexpected results.
prose.cardDesc1: Use card to highlight content blocks. Cards are useful for showcasing features, resources, or related information in visually distinct and interactive containers.
prose.cardDesc2: Customize with title, icon, and color props. Cards can also act as links using <NuxtLink> properties for navigation.
prose.cardGroupDesc: Use card-group to arrange cards in a grid layout. card-group is ideal for displaying collections of cards in a structured, visually appealing, and responsive grid.
prose.cardSaas: A template with landing, pricing, docs and blog.
prose.cardLanding: A landing page you can use as starting point.
prose.colDesc: Use collapsible to hide and reveal content sections. collapsible is ideal for showing optional details, technical specifications, or less frequently needed information.
prose.fieldDesc: Use field to describe a specific field, property, or parameter. field components are perfect for documenting API parameters, component props, or configuration options.
prose.fieldDemo: The description can be set as prop or in the default slot with full markdown support.
prose.fieldGroupDesc: Use field-group to group related fields together in a list. field-group helps organize and structure documentation for multiple related fields or properties.
prose.fgAnalyt: Default to false - Enables analytics for your project (coming soon).
prose.fgBlob: Default to false - Enables blob storage to store static assets, such as images, videos and more.
prose.fgCache: Default to false - Enables cache storage to cache your server route responses or functions using Nitro's cachedEventHandler and cachedFunction.
prose.fgDb: Default to false - Enables SQL database to store your application's data.
prose.iconDesc: Use icon to insert icons from icon libraries. Icons provide visual cues and enhance the user interface of your documentation.
prose.kbdDesc: Use kbd to display keyboard keys or shortcuts. kbd components clearly indicate keyboard inputs for instructions or command references.
prose.tabsDesc: Use tabs and tabs-item to organize content into tabbed interfaces. Tabs are effective for separating content into logical sections, improving content discoverability and organization.
prose.stepsDesc1: Use steps to create step-by-step guides from document headings. steps component automatically numbers headings, creating a numbered guide for processes and tutorials.
prose.stepsDesc2: Set the level prop to define the heading level to include in the step-by-step guide.
prose.step1: Add the Nuxt UI module in your nuxt.config.ts
prose.step2: Import Tailwind CSS and Nuxt UI in your CSS

images.subtitle: Add image, video, and other HTML elements.
images.usingMarkdownDesc: Display images using standard Markdown syntax. Markdown images are simple to implement for basic image display.
images.imageCallout: If @nuxt/image is installed, the <NuxtImg> component will be used instead of the native img tag.
images.usingEmbedsDesc: Use embeds for more image customization. Embeds offer greater control over image attributes like size and styling.
images.embedsHtmlDesc: Embeds allow adding various HTML elements like videos and iframes. This feature extends documentation capabilities to include interactive and multimedia content.

login.subtitle: Sign in to your account to continue

errors.passwordWeak: Password must be at least 8 characters long, include 1 uppercase letter, 1 lowercase letter, and 1 special character.
Password must be at least 8 characters long, include 1 uppercase letter, 1 lowercase letter, and 1 special character.
